Description:
Indicates the serial number.
It is generated by the system and the serial
number is exclusive.
Not null

Indicates the sequence number when the bill
is split. For example, special requirement of
splitting on mid-night and end of the bill
cycle.
The default value is 0.
Can be null

Indicates the timestamp of the bill item
generation.
Format: YYYYMMDDhhmmss
Not null

Indicates the service key of the intelligent
service to which the subscriber subscribes to.
The default value is 1.
Not null

Indicates the calling number. The number
format are as follows:
??Country code + Area number + PSTN
The number format is the format of the
fixed-line phone number.
??Country code + MSISDN
The number format is the format of the
mobile phone number.
??For?URI?format, example,
ABC_DE@huawei.com
[a,z],[A,Z],[0,9],_,-,.,@.
Not null

Indicates the access point.
Can be null

Indicates the accessed URL.
Can be null

Indicates the IMSI of calling party.
??When the SCP transfers an IMSI, the
value of this field is the IMSI transferred
??When the SCP does not transfer an IMSI,
the value of this field is the value of the
corresponding field in the attribute table
of the charged subscriber.
??The value is?Null?when the relevant value
cannot be obtained.
Value range: numerals within 0-9, *, #
Can be null

Indicates the address of access network.
For GPRS, it refers to the SGSN.

For WLAN, it refers to the Hotspot ID.
Can be null

Indicates the address of GGSN.
Value range: numerals within 0-9, *, #
Can be null

Indicates the information used to analyze the
roaming state of calling party.
It can be the location number, MSC address,
VLR number, and so on. The actual value is
related with the service configuration.
Value range: numerals within 0-9, *, #
Can be null

Indicates the cell ID of the calling party,
which is directly filled in according to the
IDP report.
Value range: numerals within 0-9, *, #
Can be null

Indicates the start time of the service
reported by the SGSN or external network
elements.
Format: YYYYMMDDhhmmss
Can be null

Indicates the time zone in which the SGSN
or external network elements locate.
Value range: -48-48
NOTE
The value -48 is not included.
Can be null

Indicates the time stamp of the charging
beginning.
Format: YYYYMMDDhhmmss
Can be null

Indicates the total traffic.
Unit: byte
Not null
The default value is 0.

Indicates the upstream traffic.
Unit: byte
Not null
The default value is 0.

Indicates the downstream traffic.
Unit: byte
Not null
The default value is 0.

Indicates the duration of using GPRS
service.
Unit: second
Not null
The default value is 0.

Indicates the reason why the call cannot be
connected.
The options are as follows:
??1: hang up
??2: insufficient balance
??3: over maximum duration
??99: other reasons
The default value is 0.
Can be null

A unique number which shall be allocated to
each individual mobile station equipment.
Value range: numerals within 0-9
Can be null

Indicates the sequence number of a
transaction.
Can be null

Indicates the service ID of the SP.
Can be null

Indicates the SP ID or CP ID.
Can be null

The number of the category.
Can be null

The number of the content.
Can be null

Service quality.
Can be null

Indicates the type of the original network.
The options are as follows:

??1: PSTN
??2: Mobile
??3: Native Unknown
??4: International Unknown
??Other to be extended
Can be null

Indicates a diameter session ID.
The format is as follows:
<DiameterIdentity>;<high 32 bits>;<low 32
bits>[;<optional value>]
??<DiameterIdentity>: the same as the
field in the Origin-Host AVP.
??<high 32 bits>: indicates the current time
of the system.
??<low 32 bits>: indicates the cycle count-
up. The initial value is 0. When you
restart the system, set the value to 0.
??<optional value>: indicates
implementation specific but may include
a modem's device Id, a layer 2 address,
timestamp, etc.
Separate the preceding fields with the
character ";".
For example: SCP001.huawei.com;
1876543210;523
Can be null

Indicates the brand ID of subscribers.
Not null
The default value is 0.

Indicates the main product ID of subscribers.
Not null
The default value is 0.

Indicates the telephone number of the
charging party.
The number is same as calling party number
in MO and called party number in MT.
There are several special situations. Like
Child-Parent card feature, the calling party
number is the child, the charging party
number is the parent's number. This field is
null when the service is paid only by
account.
The number format are as follows:
??Country code + Area number + PSTN
The number format is the format of the
fixed-line phone number.
??Country code + MSISDN
The number format is the format of the
mobile phone number.
??For?URI?format, example,
ABC DE@huawei.com
[a,z],[A,Z],[0,9],_,-,.,@.
Not null

Indicates the pay type of subscribers.
The options are as follows:
??0: Prepaid
??1: Postpaid
??2: Hybrid
Can be null

Indicates the bill cycle ID.
Format: YYYYMMTT
??YYYY: indicates the year.
??MM: indicates the month.
??TT: indicates the type of a bill cycle.
Value range: numerals within 0-9.
Can be null

Indicates the charging type.
The current version supports the following
types:
??0: based on duration
??1: based on traffic
Can be null

Indicates the internal result code.
Value range: -2^31-2^31-1
The default value is 0.
Can be null

Indicates the roaming state of charging
party.
The options are as follows:
??0: No roaming
??1: Roaming within charging area
??2: Roaming out of charging area
??3: International Roaming
The default value is 0.
Can be null

Indicates the home country code information
of calling party.
>=0, -1, 0 or 9999 means unknown.
The default value is 0.
Can be null

Indicates the home area number of the
calling party.
>=0, -1, 0 or 9999 means unknown.
The default value is 0.
Can be null

Indicates the home network code of the
calling party.
>=0, -1, 0 or 9999 means unknown.
The default value is 0.
Can be null

Indicates the roam country code of the
calling party.
>=0, -1, 0 or 9999 means unknown.
The default value is 0.
Can be null

Indicates the roam area number of the calling
party.
>=0, -1, 0 or 9999 means unknown.
The default value is 0.
Can be null

Indicates the roam network code of the
calling party.
>=0, -1, 0 or 9999 means unknown.
The default value is 0.
Can be null

Indicates the last effect rating product.
Can be null
Reserved

Indicates the home zone ID.
When a subscriber enjoys the home zone
discount, the value of this field is the home
zone ID of the area where the subscriber
currently locates.
The default value is 0.
Can be null

Indicates the life cycle state and the
management state of a subscriber.
The UserState parameter is a numeric string
of seven digits, in the format CCMMMMM.
The first and second digits C indicate the life
cycle state of a subscriber. The first digit C
indicates the state of a prepaid subscriber,
and the second digit C indicates the state of
a postpaid subscriber. The options are as
follows:
??0: Idle
??1: Active
??2: Suspended
??3: Disable
??4: Pool
??5: Pool without activation
The next five digits MMMMM indicate the
management state of a subscriber. The
options are as follows:
Third digit: Whether the subscriber claims
missing.
??0: no
??1: yes
Fourth digit: Whether the subscriber
suspends the service.
??0: non-suspend
??1: suspend
??2: suspend by operator (B1W)
??3: suspend by operator (B2W)
Fifth digit: Whether the subscriber applies
for suspension with the number being
reserved.
??0: no
??1: yes
Sixth digit: Whether the subscriber is
blocked.
??0: no
??1: yes
Seventh digit: Whether the subscriber is
blacklisted.
??0: no
??1: yes
Can be null

Indicates the subscriber ID.
Value range: characters in [0-9, a-z, A-Z]
Can be null

Indicates online type.
The options are as follows:
??0: online
??1: offline
The default value is 0.

Indicates the type of bearer.
The default value is 0.
Can be null

Indicates the time when the data connected.
Can be null

Indicates the time when the data
disconnected.
Can be null

Indicates the type of the bearer protocol.
When the interconnection between the OCS
system and the AAA system is enabled, this
field indicates the access network type. The
values of the field can be extended later.
The options are as follows:
??01: WAP/IP
??10: HTTP/TCP/IP
??20: STMP
??30: RTSP
??40: FTP
??100: ADSL/LAN
??101: Dial-Up/ISDN
??102: WiFi
??200: GPRS/UMTS
??300: CDMA
??400: WiMAX
??500: TD-SCDMA
??other: to be extended
The default value is 0.
Can be null

Indicates the charge ID, the system can
charge the subscriber according to this ID.
Can be null

Indicates the level of the data service.
The default value is 0.
Can be null

Indicates the start time of bill cycle.
Can be null

Indicates the charging party.
The options are as follows:

??1: The calling party is charged
??2: The called party is charged
??3: Charge of third party
??4: Charge of parent & child card
??5: Charge of calling party & VPN
Can be null

Indicates the number of the other charging
party of the child-parent cards. In the
example, the value of the field is the number
of subscriber C.
The number is same as calling party number
in MO and called party number in MT.
There are several special situations. Like
Child-Parent card feature, the calling party
number is the child, the charging party
number is the parent's number. This field is
null when the service is paid only by
account.
The number format are as follows:
??Area number + PSTN
The number format is the format of the
fixed-line telephone number.
??MSISDN
The number format is the format of the
mobile phone number.
??For?URI?format, example,
ABC DE@huawei.com
Value range: numerals within 0-9, *, #
For URI format,value range: [0-9,a-z,A-
Z,_,-,.,@]
Can be null

Indicates the payment type of the other
charging party of the child-parent cards.
The options are as follows:
??0: Prepaid
??1: Postpaid
??2: Hybrid
NOTE
If the value of the field is null, the system records
the payment type of the parent card subscriber.
Can be null

Indicates the bill cycle ID of the other
charging party of the child-parent cards. For
example, the bill cycle ID of the parent card.
Format: YYYYMMTT
The description of the format is as follows:
??YYYY: indicates the year.
??MM: indicates the month.
??TT: indicates the type of a bill cycle.
Can be null
